#### M07 - Private Use - Indemnity To Person Using
It is hereby understood and agreed that whilst the Insured Vehicle is being used by (refer to the Schedule) for social domestic or pleasure purposes with the permission of the Policyholder, the Company will in the terms of and subject to the limitations of and for the purposes of Section II of this Policy indemnify the person using the Insured Vehicle in respect of any act or omission of the driver provided that:
1. such person is not entitled to indemnity under any other policy, and
2. such person shall as though he were the Policyholder observe fulfil and be subject to the Terms of this Policy in so far as they apply.
questions: What does the M07 clause in an insurance policy cover?
Under what conditions will the insurance company indemnify a person using the insured vehicle?
Can a person using the insured vehicle for social, domestic, or pleasure purposes be indemnified under the M07 clause?
What are the prerequisites for a person to be indemnified under the M07 clause while using the insured vehicle?
Is the indemnity provided by the M07 clause applicable if the person has another insurance policy?
What obligations must a person fulfill to be covered under the M07 clause of the policy?
Does the M07 clause require the person using the insured vehicle to adhere to the terms of the policy?
What limitations are imposed by Section II of the policy in relation to the M07 clause?
In what scenarios can the M07 clause be activated for a person using the insured vehicle?
What does 'indemnity to person using' mean in the context of the M07 clause?
